description: Erection of single storey rear extension and conversion of garage to form garden room and store room
decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.	Reason:  As required  by Section 91 of  the Town  and Country Planning  Act  1990,  as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the materials specified on the approved plans and on the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The garden room and store room within the outbuilding hereby approved shall be used for purposes ancillary to the main dwellinghouse. The main dwelling house shall remain in use as a single dwelling house and the outbuilding shall not be used, sold or sub-let as a separate dwelling. Reason: A separate unit of accommodation of this nature may not be acceptable in this location in the interests of the amenities, character of the area and  highway safety in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Please be advised that this application cannot be considered as a Free-Go, as this option has previously been used with Application Ref: 21/01035/PACND. A fee of Â£234 is required. This payment can be made online at www.kingston.gov.uk or by calling our Customer Care Line on 020 8547 5022

Please provide copies of all proposed elevations at a recognised scale of 1:50 or 1:100, providing a scale bar, showing all elevations not just part and indicating all key dimensions for the proposed work.The submitted proposed elevations do not have a scale bar.

Please note that the quality of advice will be proportionate to the level of information provided, therefore it is to the applicants benefit to provide as much supporting information as possible for the proposal. eg: plans and elevations, photographs and supporting documents.
